episodes.title: Stalin's Cult of Personality - Cold War DOCUMENTARY
episodes.description:
Our historical documentary series on the history of the Cold War continues with a deeper look at Stalin's cult of personality.

How the American Political Parties Switched Their Ideologies: https://youtu.be/SdcreXEWzG0
How the RAND Corporation created American strategy: https://youtu.be/J1mH_O7MzJk
The Nuclear Wannabes: Sweden, Brazil and Argentina: https://youtu.be/1LpL6Q1s7TA
Israel: the Officially Unofficial Nuclear State: https://youtu.be/dcXSkpRDp2k
Taiwan Under the Kuomintang Dictatorship: https://youtu.be/nGYzXNpQclo
What Happened to the German and Japanese POWs?: https://youtu.be/JLK1xQV9B84
Operation Paperclip: https://youtu.be/17cNgMpBiWw
German Expulsions: https://youtu.be/zyWx4p4hiaY
Soviet Education System: https://youtu.be/AD_JwbivtMA
How Khrushchev Fed the Soviet People: https://youtu.be/qIZDa7ZcUhE
How CIA Used Art Against the USSR: https://youtu.be/EPmomdCzomA
How Nuclear Deterrence Theory developed: https://youtu.be/UHIsdbvsuOY
America's Secret Nuclear Disaster: https://youtu.be/iXSSCdlTst4

Support us on Patreon: http://www.patreon.com/TheColdWar,

*SOURCES*
Simon Sebag Montefiore, “Stalin: The Court of the Red Tsar”, Phoenix, 2003
Yoram Gorlizki and Oleg Khlevniuk, “Substate Dictatorship: networks, Loyalty, and Institutional Change in the Soviet Union”, Yale University Press, 2020
Oleg Khlevniuk, “Stalin: New Biography of a Dictator”, Yale University Press, 2017
Nicholas Riasanovsky and Mark Steinberg, “A History of Russia”, Oxford University Press, 2010
Stephen Kotkin, “Stalin: Paradoxes of Power, 1878-1928”, Penguin Books, 2015
Stephen Kotkin , “Stalin: Waiting for Hitler, 1929-1941”, Pengui Books, 2018
Robert Conquest, “The Great Terror: A reassessment”,Oxford University Press, 2007 
Anna Applebaum, “Gulag: A  History”, Vintage, 2004
